text.content:
import numpy as np
from numpy.random import randn
n, d, h, c = 64, 1000, 100, 10
x, y = randn(n, d), randn(n, c)
w1, w2 = randn(d, h), randn(h, c)
learning_rate = 1e-4
for t in range(1000):
  h = 1 / (1 + np.exp(-x.dot(w1)))
  y_pred = h.dot(w2)
  loss = np.square(y_pred - y).sum()
  print(t, loss)
  grad_y_pred = 2.0 * (y_pred - y)
  grad_w2 = h.T.dot(grad_y_pred)
  grad_h = grad_y_pred.dot(w2.T)
  grad_w1 = x.T.dot(grad_h * h * (1 - h))
  w1 -= learning_rate * grad_w1
  w2 -= learning_rate * grad_w

rich_text.plain_text:
import numpy as np
from numpy.random import randn
n, d, h, c = 64, 1000, 100, 10
x, y = randn(n, d), randn(n, c)
w1, w2 = randn(d, h), randn(h, c)
learning_rate = 1e-4
for t in range(1000):
  h = 1 / (1 + np.exp(-x.dot(w1)))
  y_pred = h.dot(w2)
  loss = np.square(y_pred - y).sum()
  print(t, loss)
  grad_y_pred = 2.0 * (y_pred - y)
  grad_w2 = h.T.dot(grad_y_pred)
  grad_h = grad_y_pred.dot(w2.T)
  grad_w1 = x.T.dot(grad_h * h * (1 - h))
  w1 -= learning_rate * grad_w1
  w2 -= learning_rate * grad_w

equation.expression: \frac{\partial\cal L}{\partial x}=\frac{\partial\cal L}{\partial z}\frac{\partial z}{\partial x}, \frac{\partial\cal L}{\partial y}=\frac{\partial\cal L}{\partial z}\frac{\partial z}{\partial y}
\begin{aligned}x\in\R^n,&&y\in\R,&&\frac{\partial y}{\partial x}\in\R^n &&\left(\frac{\partial y}{\partial x}\right)_i=\frac{\partial y_j}{\partial x_i}\end{aligned}
\begin{aligned}x\in\R^n,&&y\in\R^m,&&\frac{\partial y}{\partial x}\in\R^{n\times m} &&\left(\frac{\partial y}{\partial x}\right)_{ij}=\frac{\partial y_j}{\partial x_i}\end{aligned}

text.content: Adagrad: element-wise scaling of the gradient based on the historical sum of squares in each dimension

text.content: RMSProp: Leaky Adagrad: Adagrad can lead to quickly shrinking learning rate, so add convex combination

text.content: However, it has vanishing gradient problem, and fails to model long-range dependence in a sequence

rich_text.plain_text: However, it has vanishing gradient problem, and fails to model long-range dependence in a sequence

text.content: For RNN, input sequence length acts like depth, so W is large then gradient explodes → clipping can be solution but it can’t maintain gradient direction

rich_text.plain_text: For RNN, input sequence length acts like depth, so W is large then gradient explodes → clipping can be solution but it can’t maintain gradient direction

text.content: To avoid vanishing gradient problem, we make new set of hidden state

text.content: with a highway detouring FC layer

rich_text.plain_text: with a highway detouring FC layer

text.content: Even if the cell state is for long term memory, we still need some mechanism to control it(forget gate)

rich_text.plain_text: Even if the cell state is for long term memory, we still need some mechanism to control it(forget gate)

text.content: At the input side, add the input gate to control the flow from the input

text.content: Lastly, we add output gate to control the value updated to the hidden state

rich_text.plain_text: Lastly, we add output gate to control the value updated to the hidden state

text.content: LSTM doesn’t guarantee that there is no vanishing/exploding gradient, but it does provide an easier way for the model to learn long-distance dependencies

text.content: No additional cell states as in LSTM

rich_text.plain_text: No additional cell states as in LSTM

text.content: Provide a gradient highway similar to LSTM, using convex combination of previous hidden state and new one computed from the input

rich_text.plain_text: Provide a gradient highway similar to LSTM, using convex combination of previous hidden state and new one computed from the input

text.content: RNN assumes 1:1 relationship, so input length and output length must be same

rich_text.plain_text: Q and K must be comparable, V and attention value are in the same dimensionality

text.content: In seq2seq, Q is decoder hidden state, K is encoder hidden state and V is the encoder hidden state

text.content: Then, we take softmax to get attention coefficients for this time step

rich_text.plain_text: Then, we take softmax to get attention coefficients for this time step

text.content: We take weighted sum of the encoder hidden states according to the attention coefficients, to get the attention value

rich_text.plain_text: We take weighted sum of the encoder hidden states according to the attention coefficients, to get the attention value

text.content: Finally, we concentrate the attention value with the decoder hidden state and proceed as in the vanilla seq2seq model:
